rComments: Extremely straightforward teacher, still explained relationships like colonization & imperialism well for an under-div like this.  The midterm is tricky in that it's long essays in class (which you might not finish), final is take-home. Read the assigned readings at least once so you know what sources to cite for the handful of essays he'll assign.
Pretty nice teacher overall but give A LOT of readings. He clearly devoted efforts in this class. If you keep up with the reading, you should easily pass this class.
The lectures for the class can get boring but he is a great guy. Their is a midterm that is open note and a take home final. Its pretty easy as long as you do the readings and go to class.

Really good but intense history course about Colonial Mexico, though you'll soon find out there's more to the class than that. Kind of boring subject (I just took him to fulfill a major requirement), but O'Hara was really intelligent and comprehensible teacher who obviously loves his subject. If history is your passion, I strongly recommend him.

Loved this class. O'Hara knows what he is talking about and is enthusiastic about the subject. The class was based on a midterm and two or three essays. Do the reading and go to lecture and it will be easy. Also, he gets mad if you fall asleep in class. He will throw things at you. You've been warned

He selected interesting readings and a decent amount, 4 books plus a reader. His lectures were well organized and contained relevant information but he taught like it was a high school class, or maybe lower division. In an upper division class we simply should not be required to turn in sentence outlines, we know how to write at that point.

His lectures were at times interesting, but boring most of the time. The readings are interesting, they are helpful when writing the papers. There were 2 papers, an open note midterm and take home final. Great class overall, didn't do much of the readings and did well in the class. Lectures provide most of the info for essays.
He knows how to keep the class awake! Parts of the tests were take-home which is always nice. Also the sections were great!

I appreciated how organized this class was.  He lectures from outlines that he usually writes on the board so you can follow along. I took the course (Colonial Mexico) over the summer, so it was kind of rushed, but I still learned a lot and liked his lecture style.  He's definitely a chill guy.
Great lecturer, great sense of humor and great to look at! He is engaging, well organized and knows his stuff. O'hara is by far the professor I've taken in Santa Cruz.

The lectures were kinda tough (8AM in Merrill), but once I got used to it, this really grew on me.  Very interesting stuff, good readings, and not too much work.  The TA's tend to have massive egos, so choose wisely, but in general this was an excellent class and an excellent teacher.

I went to his History of Mexico 1850-Present in summer, so maybe it was harder because he had to cram everything in. Most of the essays basically ask you to recite what was learned in class, and theres a lot. But it's not that hard, he's a fair grader, and if you put in the time, you'll get an A
